title: Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) on External CDN Resources
description: The HTML page loads external JavaScript and CSS resources from Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) without implementing Subresource Integrity (SRI) hashes. External resources include: jQuery 3.5.1 from code.jquery.com, Popper.js from cdn.jsdelivr.net, Bootstrap 4.5.2 CSS and JavaScript from stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com. Without SRI integrity attributes, these resources are vulnerable to tampering. If a CDN is compromised or a man-in-the-middle attack occurs, malicious code could be injected into the page. SRI (Subresource Integrity) is a security feature that enables browsers to verify that resources they fetch are delivered without unexpected manipulation by including a cryptographic hash of the resource's content in the resource tag.
impact: An attacker who can intercept or compromise the CDN could: (1) Inject arbitrary JavaScript code that executes in users' browsers with full access to the application context, (2) Steal session tokens or authentication cookies enabling account takeover, (3) Perform keylogging or form hijacking to capture sensitive user input, (4) Conduct phishing attacks by modifying page content, (5) Redirect users to malicious sites, (6) Perform unauthorized actions on behalf of the user including data theft or modification, (7) Install malware or tracking code, (8) Compromise the integrity of the entire application for all users relying on the affected CDN resources.
evidence:
POC execution confirmed 4 external resources loaded without Subresource Integrity attributes:

1. VULNERABLE (no SRI): https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.5.1.slim.min.js
2. VULNERABLE (no SRI): https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@popperjs/core@2.9.2/dist/umd/popper.min.js
3. VULNERABLE (no SRI): https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/js/bootstrap.min.js
4. VULNERABLE (no SRI): https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/css/bootstrap.min.css

HTML source inspection shows external resources loaded without SRI:
- <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/css/bootstrap.min.css"> - NO integrity attribute
- <script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.5.1.slim.min.js"></script> - NO integrity attribute
- <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@popperjs/core@2.9.2/dist/umd/popper.min.js"></script> - NO integrity attribute
- <script src="https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/js/bootstrap.min.js"></script> - NO integrity attribute

Expected format with SRI (missing in all resources):
<script src="..." integrity="sha384-..." crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
remediation:
1. Add SRI integrity hashes to all external resource tags. For example: <script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.5.1.slim.min.js" integrity="sha384-DfXdz2htPH0lsSSs5nCTpuj/zy4C+OGpamoFVy38MVBnE+IbbVYUew+OrCXaRkfj" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

2. Use https://www.srihash.org to generate correct SRI hashes for each resource or use the SRI Hash Generator command: npm install -g sri-hash && sri-hash <resource_url>

3. Add crossorigin="anonymous" attribute to all external resources to enable CORS validation

4. For CSS resources, add integrity and crossorigin attributes: <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/css/bootstrap.min.css" integrity="sha384-..." crossorigin="anonymous">

5. If using npm/build tools, use automated SRI generation tools like webpack-subresource-integrity or during build process

6. Document SRI values in source control and update them when resource versions change

7. Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) headers to further restrict and validate script sources

8. Consider using package managers or dependency management tools that automatically provide SRI hashes

9. Regularly audit and update external dependencies to latest secure versions
references: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity, CWE-353: Missing Support for Integrity Checking in HTTP Request, OWASP A06:2021 - Vulnerable and Outdated Components, MDN: Subresource Integrity (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Subresource_Integrity), W3C: Subresource Integrity Specification (https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-subresource-integrity/)
toolCallDescription: Document the Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) finding with POC confirmation showing 4 unprotected external CDN resources
